meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: CENSORSHIP

div.a: Google Executive Arrested In Brazil After Refusing To Freeze Political Speech On YouTube

div.div: According to "Globo," Google executive Fabio José Silva Coelho has been arrested by federal police in Brazil, after the company refused a judge's order to remove a controversial political video from YouTube.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OVFkqy&via=Digg&text=Google Executive Arrested In Brazil After Refusing To Freeze Political Speech On YouTube

div.div: WHERE IN THE WORLD IS JIMMY?

div.a: Has There Been A Break In The Hoffa Case?

div.div: Investigators will take soil samples from the ground beneath a suburban Detroit driveway after a man told police he believes he witnessed the burial of missing Teamsters leader Jimmy Hoffa about 35 years ago, police said Wednesday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QciI07&via=Digg&text=Has There Been A Break In The Hoffa Case?

div.div: WOULD YOU LIKE TV WITH THAT?
McDonald's is launching a custom TV channel at 700 pilot restaurants.
DRUGS
When people try to quit smoking pot, they experience real withdrawal symptoms that can affect their daily lives, a new study from Australia says.
THE WEDDING PLANNER

div.a: Tycoon Offers $65 Million To Any Man Who 'Wins' Lesbian Daughter's Heart

div.div: A Hong Kong tycoon has offered a $65 million "marriage bounty" to any man who can win the heart of his lesbian daughter, a report said Wednesday.

li.div: Man who's slept with 10,000 women is "pro-family": offers cash to any man who'll break up daughter's same sex p'ship: france24.com/en/20120926-h...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OTO9RA&via=Digg&text=Tycoon Offers $65 Million To Any Man Who 'Wins' Lesbian Daughter's Heart

div.div: YOU CAN BUY ONE FOR THE PRICE OF A COFFEE

div.a: Identity Crisis: How Social Security Numbers Became Our Insecure National ID

div.div: The SSN-as-ID thing has got to stop. How did we get here, and can we get out?

li.div: Also, Social Security numbers are some scary weird shit. theverge.com/2012/9/26/338...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P5A2TE&via=Digg&text=Identity Crisis: How Social Security Numbers Became Our Insecure National ID

div.div: TEQUILA IS REALLY VOLATILE RIGHT NOW
Usually, the only math required at a bar is tip calculation. But a new algorithm-based program makes ordering cocktails much like playing the stock market.
DIRE PREDICTIONS

div.a: 100 Million To Die By 2030 If World Fails To Act On Climate1

div.div: More than 100 million people will die and global economic growth will be cut by 3.2 percent of gross domestic product (GDP) by 2030 if the world fails to tackle climate change, a report commissioned by 20 governments said on Wednesday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TCnFWO&via=Digg&text=100 Million To Die By 2030 If World Fails To Act On Climate1

div.div: ASTRONOMY

div.a: The New Dark Energy Camera That Will Change Our Understanding Of The Universe

div.div: The first instrument ever built specifically to help astronomers study the effects of dark energy is now ready to document the history of the cosmos.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QmytoX&via=Digg&text=The New Dark Energy Camera That Will Change Our Understanding Of The Universe

div.div: LAWSUITS

div.a: Book Publisher Sues To Recoup Advances From Ana Marie Cox

div.div: A New York publisher this week filed lawsuits against several prominent writers who failed to deliver books for which they received hefty contractual advances, records show.

li.div: TIP: MEET YOUR DEADLINES. It's in their rights to recoup those advances if the author didn't produce. thesmokinggun.com/buster/p...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TxgSOh&via=Digg&text=Book Publisher Sues To Recoup Advances From Ana Marie Cox

div.div: USEFUL APPS

div.a: Meet The App That's Filling The Giant Hole Left By Apple's Maps

div.div: Whether you think the criticism is an overreaction or not, the truth is Apple Maps are less useful than they were before, leaving an open opportunity for third party mapping apps to take advantage. One of those apps is Embark, a popular transit directions app for the iPhone.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S76LsL&via=Digg&text=Meet The App That's Filling The Giant Hole Left By Apple's Maps

div.div: BUBBA

div.a: Bill Clinton Could Be President Again

div.div: Speaking to CNN's Piers Morgan at the Clinton Global Initiative last night he briefly mulled a return to presidential politics. Except not in the United States — where the 22nd Amendment forbids it — but just across the pond.
SCIENCE

div.a: New Theory On Why Men Love Breasts

div.div: Why do straight men devote so much headspace to those big, bulbous bags of fat drooping from women's chests? Scientists have never satisfactorily explained men's curious breast fixation, but now, a neuroscientist has struck upon an explanation that he says "just makes a lot of sense."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RiYYew&via=Digg&text=New Theory On Why Men Love Breasts

div.div: "I'M TIRED, AND IT'S HARD TO FOCUS"

div.a: Phoenix Mayor Attempts To Live On Foodstamps

div.div: When local activist groups challenged Phoenix Mayor Greg Stanton to live on a food stamp budget for a week to mark Hunger Awareness Month, he took them up on the offer and found out just how hard it was.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P6xWCY&via=Digg&text=Phoenix Mayor Attempts To Live On Foodstamps

div.div: PUTTING HUMPTY DUMPTY BACK TOGETHER

div.a: Regrown Bones, Transplanted Faces: This Chemist Is Remaking Military Medicine

div.div: Dr. Joachim Kohn has never seen combat. He has never retaliated enemy fire, deployed with a platoon to some foreign, war-ravaged nation, or ridden shotgun in a tank. But from his first years of childhood to his military-funded, revolutionary scientific innovations, Kohn’s life has been indelibly marked by armed conflict.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SpjxId&via=Digg&text=Regrown Bones, Transplanted Faces: This Chemist Is Remaking Military Medicine

div.div: POLITICALLY INCORRECT

The San Francisco Police Department, relying on antiquated computer technology, routinely recorded nearly all Asians who were arrested in the city as “Chinese” until this month, department officials said.
TELECOMMUTING

div.a: Beam Yourself To Work In A Remote-Controlled Body

div.div: An early Google engineer and now an investor and entrepreneur, thinks he has the solution for companies that think they're wasting time and money chasing new hires: make it more practical for engineers living in cheaper places to telecommute to work.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qwl8tP&via=Digg&text=Beam Yourself To Work In A Remote-Controlled Body

div.div: SAVE THE PUBS, SAVE THE WORLD

div.a: How Bad Is The Euro Crisis? Even Irish Pubs Are Feeling The Pinch

div.div: Pubs are closing at a rate of one every other day. The Euro crisis must be stopped!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Rai4TT&via=Digg&text=How Bad Is The Euro Crisis? Even Irish Pubs Are Feeling The Pinch
